question: The critical mean temperature for flowering and fertilization in rice ranges from
The critical mean temperature for ripening in rice ranges from
pH suitable for rice ranges from
Identify the wrong statement
options: Mundakan is the second rice growing season
Puncha generally coincides with summer period
Virippu starts from april and extends till september
Mundakan starts from december and extends till march
correctAnswer: Mundakan starts from december and extends till march

question: Identify the common character shared by the rice varieties Uma and Vyttila 2
options: Both are long duration varieties recommended for Pokkali area
Both are short duration varieties recommended for Kaipad tracts
Both are medium duration varieties recommended for Kari soils
correctAnswer: Both are medium duration varieties recommended for Kari soils

question: The rice variety which is generally recommended as a contingent variety for areas where there is crop loss is
Hraswa is a
options: Rice variety with red colored bold grains

question: A rice variety released by College of Agriculture Vellayani which is recommended for southern region for Virippu season for delayed sowing
For rice seed production, the minimum isolation distance that should be maintained to ensure genetic purity is
For quality seed production in rice, the moisture content that should be maintained after harvesting is
For storage of rice seed grains generally polythene bags of 700 gauge or double gunny bags are recommended. But the seeds can be preferably stored in 400 gauge polythene bags if
options: seeds are dried to 10% moisture or less
storage is for short period, usually between 3 to 4 months
correctAnswer: seeds are dried to 10% moisture or less

question: The viability of short duration varieties of rice can be extended for a period of 2-3 months at 80% level if the seeds are
options: soaked in brine solution, dried in shade back to 13% moisture level
soaked in CuSO4 solution, followed by soaking in water, drying back to 10% moisture level
soaked in water, dried in shade back to 13% moisture level
correctAnswer: soaked in water, dried in shade back to 13% moisture level

question: To keep sprouted Pokkali seeds viable for two weeks, the seeds are
options: kept in baskets made of plaited coconut leaves lined with koova, banana, karingotta or teak leaves
kept in basket made of moistened rice straws lined with koova, banana, karingotta or teak leaves
placed in a dapog mat nursery supplemented with 2% brine
soaked for 12 to 16 hours in water
correctAnswer: kept in baskets made of plaited coconut leaves lined with koova, banana, karingotta or teak leaves

question: The seed rate of rice under transplanting method is
The seed rate of rice under broadcasting method is
The seed rate of rice under dibbling method is
The seed rate of rice under SRI method is

Recommended lime dose for rice main field is
Alternaria padwickii causes
The total seed bed area for 1 ha of paddy main field is
The amount of compost or cattle manure to be added to paddy nursery bed is
The depth of irrigation followed in paddy seedbed to control weeds is
Nitrogen deficiency in paddy seedbed can be combated by broadcasting urea
Paddy seedlings are ready to be transplanted at 4 to 5 leaf stage which is
options: about 18 after sowing days for SD varieties
about 20 to 25 days after sowing for MD varieties
about 30 days after sowing for LD varieties

question: In cases where paddy transplanting is delayed, the following measures can be adopted
options: Plant at wider spacing (40 cm gap) and apply more nitrogen @ 5kg/ha as basal dressing
Plant at closer spacing (3/4 seedlings per hill) and apply more nitrogen @ 5kg/ha as basal dressing
Plant at closer spacing (3/4 seedlings per hill) and apply more phosphorus @ 2.5kg/ha as basal dressing
correctAnswer: Plant at closer spacing (3/4 seedlings per hill) and apply more nitrogen @ 5kg/ha as basal dressing

question: The best time to transplant paddy seedlings is _______ after incorporating organic manure
Cracking is usually found in Kari soils of Kuttanad region. To prevent cracking by prolonged drying, the following method can be adopted
options: Flooding the land with 2 cm depth of water
Providing surface drains of 20 cm width and depth within the field at 10-20 m interval and joining them with surface drain of 30 cm width and depth taken along perimeter of field
Providing surface drains of 40 cm width and 25 cm depth within the field at 5 m interval and joining them with surface drain of 50 cm width and depth taken along perimeter of field
Providing surface drains of 20 cm width and depth within the field at 10-20 m interval and joining them with surface drain of 30 cm width and depth running diagonally
correctAnswer: Providing surface drains of 20 cm width and depth within the field at 10-20 m interval and joining them with surface drain of 30 cm width and depth taken along perimeter of field

question: Cowpea can be raised as an intercrop in dry seeded low land (semi-dry) rice by sowing __________ seed along with the rice to serve as a source of green manure
When there is a delay in onset of monsoon, the intercropped cowpea can be incorporated in rice fields by
The green manure intercrop recommended for wet seeded rice is
explanation:
Dry seeded rice: Cowpea @ 12.5 kg/ha
Wet seeded rice: Daincha @ 20 kg/ha

question: The green manure intercrop recommended for dry seeded rice is
explanation:
Dry seeded rice: Cowpea @ 12.5 kg/ha
Wet seeded rice: Daincha @ 20 kg/ha

question: What is the general recommendation of fertilizer dosage (in N:P:K kg/ha) for rice in wetland type of cultivation
For Thiruvananthapuram and Malappuram districts, _____ application is necessary for increasing rice yields
Identify the correct statement regarding fertilizer application in Koottumundakan system for better yield
options: 20:10:10 kg NPK/ha for the first crop and 30:15:15 kg NPK/ha for the second crop
30:15:15 kg NPK/ha for the first crop and 20:10:10 kg NPK/ha for the second crop
20:10:10 kg NPK/ha for the first crop and 40:10:10 kg NPK/ha for the second crop
correctAnswer: 20:10:10 kg NPK/ha for the first crop and 30:15:15 kg NPK/ha for the second crop

question: The fertilizer dosage (kg NPK/ha) recommended for Virippu (photo insensitive) varieties in Koottumundakan system is

The following method can be used to increase the efficiency of urea for top dressing
options: Mixing urea with six times its weight of slightly moist soil
Mixing neem cake and urea (1:5 by weight)
Mixing punna cake and urea (1:5 by weight)

question: Under special conditions of drought and water logging in rice fields, the following method can be adopted for the application of nitrogen
options: Low volume spray @ 15% conc. or High volume spray @ 5 % conc.
Low volume spray @ 5% conc. or High volume spray @ 15 % conc.
Low volume spray @ 20% conc. or High volume spray @ 15 % conc.
Low volume spray @ 5% conc. or High volume spray @ 1 % conc.
correctAnswer: Low volume spray @ 15% conc. or High volume spray @ 5 % conc.
explanation: Limited to 15 kg/ha in one application

question: Zinc deficiency in rice fields can be overcomed by the application of Zinc sulphate at the rate of
Early stages of zinc deficiency in rice fields are evidenced by
options: Interveinal chlorosis, bleaching of midribs and light yellow discoloration of the leaves
Purplish discoloration, bleaching of midribs and interveinal chlorosis
Interveinal chlorosis, light yellow discoloration and reduced panicles
correctAnswer: Interveinal chlorosis, bleaching of midribs and light yellow discoloration of the leaves
explanation: Interveinal chlorosis, bleaching of midribs and light yellow discoloration of the leaves. Older leaves develop rusty brown spots and are extremely brittle.
